text: Appearance- golden, some haze, a huge white bubbly head of 3-4 fingers. Aroma- orange, spices, bready malt hints, cut grass, soft hops, lemon. Taste- full-bodied. Sugary fruit, lemon drops, bitter hops, candied fruit, sticky malt, fluffy in the mouth, orange, hints of apple and tropical fruit. Good stuff.
Reminds me somewhat of duvel hazy gold big head taste honey pilsner is defiantly recognisable in it with the peppery hop good stuff

Bottle 330ml. [ As Marble Into The Void ].Clear medium yellow color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, sweet malt, fruity malt, moderate to light light heavy hoppy, grass, citrus, sulfur notes. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, grass, citrus, fruity hops, pale malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20161127]
 8-3-8-3-15

Pure honey dew melon juice, slightly sweet, smooth almost oily mouthfeel. bread, caramel, floral, some grapefruit. Best version of Imperial Pilsner Ive had. 

More an India Pale Lager.

330 ml bottle. Courtesy of  Euphemos!
Cloudy pale golden color with a small white head.
Very nice NZ hoppy aroma with some bitterness and fruity freshness. The flavor is strong bitterness, NZ hops, some balancing maltiness and some fruitiness. Nice. Tasty.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Milky golden body with a thick white head. Low carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of corn flakes, lemon zest and pineapple. Flavour of sponge cake, tinned oranges, green tea and hay. Medium body with a creamy texture. Soft fizz. Quite sweet but with interesting flavours.

Bottle at home thanks to Santa minutemat! A bit hazy golden with good sized white head. Lots of mango, pineapple and other tropical fruits. Almost like fruit juice. Theres also some dank marijuana (haze) with grass and herbs. Light creamy malts, slightly crisp at the same time which sounds weird but it works nice. Its about medium sweet and slightly lighter bitter in a grassy way. Could maybe be a touch more bitter to balance the sweetness though the bitterness gets more pronounced as the beer warms a bit. Over medium bodied with slight crisp finish. Very nice beer.

20th December 2016Hazy yellowish gold beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Palate is airy, fairly dry and has good fine minerally carbonation. Nice malts, light and slightly bready in that Czech pils way. Touch of creamy sweetness. Tangy start to the hops and then good spicy grapefruit, soft skunk underneath. Touches of tangy orange and lemon. Light hop spicy finish. Comes together well in to a very good hoppy lager.

Grain and cereal malts, straw, some floral hops, citrus and tropical fruits, mango, unripe honey melon. Slightly hazy gold, small, creamy, white head. Medium sweet. Bittersweet citrus fruits, grapefruit, orange peel, sweet grain malts, soft carbonation, medium bodied, light alcohol in the finish, more bitter lemon. Very nice Imperial Pilsner, excellent complexity unable aroma and palate, great example of this otherwise often abused style. Bottle from Hop Locker, Waterloo.
Phew. Imperial it is. Crisp dry and loads of fruits, resin and bitterness. Still recognizable as pilsner, but a long way from it and so much better.

Bottle at home in London - picked up at Hop Locker. Pours mostly clear, bright gold with a fluffy, white head. Great snout, loads of juicy citrus fruits, pale bread, mango, melon. Medium sweet flavour with moderate pale great character, some piney hops, diesel, lemon peel, grapefruit pith. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Finishes with a little alcohol warmth, mellow resin, some further lemon peel, grapefruit. Great stuff.

330ml bottle. Clear golden colour. White head. NZ hop flavoured aroma. White grape, pithy tangerine, tomato seed. Bitter taste with something vegetal lurking. Wouldnt guess the style if I didnt know. Nice effort.

330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, whilst listening to Black Cobra. Pours a misty gold, small white head. Aroma is fruity with apricots and mango. Taste continues with smooth fleshy exotic fruit, lime juice and some grapefruit bitterness. Has very little in the way of pilsner characteristics really. Similar to Damage Plans smooth fruity DIPA leanings. Very good.
